title: Reginald D Hunter webchat â as it happened | Stage | The Guardian
summary: `` donald trump is exactly what we deserve ''
`` i have a problem with what passes as female solidarity ''
`` anyone that uses the phrase 'the n-word ' is unprepared to have any substantive discussion about the word ''
`` the confederate flag is a peripheral issue ''
`` i try to go on all the rides that the amusement park of life offers before the park closes ''
post your questions for reginald d hunter .

documents.title: that 's everything from reginald
text: reginald is wrapping up : guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:31pm thanks for all your questions .

i look forward to your support as i march on towards the family entertainment portion of my career if you 're in edinburgh , you can check out his show bitchproof at the pleasance courtyard until august 30 .
many thanks to him for answering all your questions !
hazelgroover asks : are you living in the uk full time ?
( do n't worry - nobody from immigration reads the guardian ) and if you 're over here for a long time , does your accent change ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:29pm i split my time between here and georgia .
fruitbatty asks : i remember watching have i got news for you a few years ago , and there being a couple of cheap jokes about the us being late to join wars .
are you surprised to the extent the world wars are engrained in british culture - is it a similar situation in the us ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:28pm i am surprised how much they are engrained and clung to .
just as much as i 'm surprised about how the politics that preceded them are forgotten .
redwaterblues asks : who 's your for labour leader and why ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:26pm me .
duxfeminafacti asks : which is the worst place you have ever been to in the uk and why ( excluding cumbernauld and slough ) ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:26pm burnley .
i wo n't say it 's the worst but it 's definitely the bleakest .

documents.title: `` donald trump is exactly what we deserve ''
text: paqman78 asks : what do you think of donald trump ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:25pm i think he 's entertaining .
and refreshing if for no other reason than as a sheer break to the plastic , platitudinal , generic stump speech making politicians that we are seeing .
remember the whole construct is corrupt .
we accuse politicians of not being truthful yet destroy them when they are .
donald trump is exactly what we deserve .
dansmith asks : how well do you think the british comedy circuit deals with issues of race ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:24pm well , considering the increasing number of black standups i see coming into the industry , i 'd say pretty well .
cathyfeeny asks : how does british humour differ from american ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:22pm american people do n't ask about the british sense of humour as much
markiw asks : do you think comedy can help to change peoples ' minds ?
or do you feel you are just preaching to the converted in your gigs ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:22pm i believe that anything that 's in the ether can land with anyone at any time .
i believe i have made some small contribution to our recent moments .
and anybody that gets called controversial as much as i do is not always preaching to the converted .

documents.title: `` i have a problem with what passes as female solidarity ''
text: itguy2 asks : in your previous show , you hated all this female solidarity bullshit .
can you explain your choice of title for your new show bitchproof ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:20pm i do n't have any problem with female solidarity .
i have a problem with what passes as female solidarity .
i could explain the title of my show but i 've opted to do that nightly , on stage , rather than here .
iainfm asks : why are you always going on about women , reg ?
do you want to be one ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:19pm well , if i did , i do n't know that talking about women will get me there .
i talk about women for the same reason i talk about race .
they are prevalent and so are their issues .
i talk about women , i talk about men .
the question is : why do you think i talk about women so much ?

vmclau asks : other than being asked about whether that joke about rape crossed the line ( not really a question ) or whether the n-bomb is offensive- what do you find yourself being offended by ? also you should come to manchester on your tour rather than staying down south with big nige .
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:16pm what offends me ?
people who insist on taking your photograph without inquiring whether or not you wished to have your photograph taken .
manchester ?
yes , tonight .
coming straight to your house now .
thegrinch1897 asks : do you have a say in the final edit when you appear on panel shows ?
say if you 've told a joke which you 're not happy with , can you tell the producers to cut it out of the show due to be aired .
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:12pm i do n't know !
i 've never said a joke i 've wanted to be replaced that badly .
usually , if it 's a joke i feel that badly about then the producers will feel the same way as well about it .
i 've had jokes that i wish stayed in the edit that did n't .
thecuregalore94 asks : what 's your favourite fuck you movie ' ?
i remember liking your stand-up on the matter and i was curious to hear if you could dub one a favourite now .
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:11pm these are movies that do n't care about pandering to classic , mainstream , cute , beautiful endings .
the japanese movies cold fish and the suicide club come to mind .
rinzai asks : optimism , realism or pessimism ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:08pm um .
realism with a slight lean towards optimism .

documents.title: `` anyone that uses the phrase 'the n-word ' is unprepared to have any substantive discussion about the word ''
text: za gul asks : what do you think of the use of the n-word in stand-up comedy ?
is it not promoting a stereotype , rather than combating racism ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:08pm i think anyone that uses the phrase `` the n-word '' is unprepared to have any substantive discussion about the word .

documents.title: `` the confederate flag is a peripheral issue ''
text: amphi asks : as another southerner what 's your take on the battle flag and what to do with all those statues ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:06pm removing both or either will have the uninteresting effect of making some people feel better and some others feel worse .
it is a peripheral issue around the issue .
and i wish not to get caught up there - and i wish black people did n't either .
kickback2tunes asks : how much does your material change as you progress through a night after night schedule such as the fringe ?
would you push the limits more towards the start or the end of the run ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:05pm my set evolves as the festival goes on if for no other reason than boredom with your own ideas .
there are lots of people , i call them outragists , they 're going to be perpetually outraged by something - it could be anything .
that might happen any night i 'm on .
aiden macfarlane asks : how do you personally decide where the line is ' when deciding to go with a joke or leave it alone .
i have heard some of your jokes / stories - including the one about rape - that i felt were well over the line and offensive as well as hurtful .
what process do you use , to work out how to justify to yourself that a certain joke is ok and worth telling .
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 12:02pm i start by realising that what 's offensive to one person - you , in this case - is not offensive or over the line to someone else .
i also had things to say about the subject of rape that were valid and the kind of things that do n't ever seem to be brought up and discussed by anti-rape campaigners .
if you found it over the line , more than likely it was constructed for people just like yourself .
glen pierce asks : collard greens and grits or spinach and swede ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:58am collard greens .

documents.title: `` i try to go on all the rides that the amusement park of life offers before the park closes ''
text: jesse coleman asks : how do you deal with the certainty that one day you will die , and that ultimately your life may have been meaningless ?
should we deal with the absurdity of the human condition through laughter alone ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:57am whoo .
let me see .
there 's nothing to deal with in terms of `` certainty '' .
you are going to die one day - in some ways , that 's a relief .
the entire business of decision-making is taken out of your hands .
i try to go on all the rides that the amusement park of life offers before the park closes .
and deal with absurdity through laughter ?
yes .
markalastair asks : which politician could make it in stand up ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:55am i heard obama 's pretty good when he 's attending dinners and stuff
greatplaingirl asks : i loved your show about the songs of the south .
will we see you in another travelogue any time soon ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:54am possibly , maybe .
but no one has signed or confirmed anything .
there 's any number of documentary subjects that i 'd still like to explore .
id8378794 asks : do you still like coming to the uk ?
as you once said , uk is great because you can go out at night and see girls dressed up as hookers !
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:51am very much .
i enjoy it so much that i consider it my home

headswapboy asks : have you cheered up some since i saw you at the landmark theatre in ilfracombe a couple of years ago as it seemed more than just your act ? and can you think of a more appropriate place than ilfracombe to be miserable ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:52am nope .
i might have just happened to be in a bad mood .
statusnonquo asks : hi reg !
do you ever get to hang out with/meet on the circuit other edgy ' comedians like sarah silverman or amy schumer and what do you think of their material ?
and how do you rate american stand up generally at the moment ?
any favourites you 'd actually pay to see ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:50am i have yet to meet either of those people but the comedy world is full of edgy yet-to-be-heard-of people
nivlek47 asks : have you been offered or turned down any significant or minor roles in movies ?
guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:49am no .
but i 'd like to be dr who .

reginald has joined us at the edinburgh festival , and is getting ready to answer your questions , complete with quizzical eyebrow : wiegand guardian contributor reginalddhunter 17 august 2015 11:47am reginald d hunter is up and running !

documents.title: post your questions for reginald d hunter
text: with his easy chuckle and broad smile , you might not instantly peg reginald d hunter as a firebrand but his standup comedy is some of the most ferocious and uncompromising out there .

from the pc-baiting tours trophy nigga and pride & prejudice ¦ & niggas , to riling up corporate football events with the n-word , hunter steams through social niceties to get to the heart of racism and other big issues .
his new show , bitchproof , currently playing at the edinburgh festival , is no exception , lining up the likes of bill cosby for an interrogation .

but hunter recently assured the guardian that i 'm less angry about things like racism , gender politics , capitalism , ex-girlfriends , and he 's broadening out into new projects , such as his survey of southern us music for the bbc this year .
mellower or not , he 's joining us in edinburgh to answer your questions about his career in a live webchat from 12noon bst onwards on monday 17 august .
post them in the comments below , and he 'll answer as many as possible .

bulletin.text: The outspoken comic answered your questions in a live webchat from the Edinburgh festival and addressed everything from Donald Trump to the phrase the n-word'
